sample_docs: Map data at scale from street-level imagery Images from all over the world processed with computer vision. Mapillary helps create better maps for smarter cities, geospatial services, and automotive. Make up-to-date maps faster and more efficiently Create your own street-level imagery Extract map data automatically with computer vision Collaborate with others to capture imagery and generate map data Access fresh data from a global contributor network Integrate imagery into any app, tool, or web page Accelerate your workflows with automatically extracted map data Start sharing images and accessing map data

Mapillary is powered by world-class computer vision 3D reconstruction and semantic segmentation connect images and extract map data at scale for smart cities, geospatial services, and autonomous vehicles. What we do with computer vision We'd be happy to tell you more about our technology and how it works in our products.

Fixed bug where tapping "Cancel" in the project selector after initial sign-in would crash the app. The app now takes a photo every 15 degrees when turning (was 30 degrees before). Web app: Updated Capture Projects; and Mapillary for Drivers on iOS 1.0 An update for Capture Projects comes with changes and new features both in the Web App and in the accompanying Mapillary for Drivers on iOS. In particular this release lets the administrator of the capture project configure project behavior, which is then reflected in the mobile app. This means fewer settings can or need to be controlled by the driver. Added support for capture outside of task areas (defined by project-wide setting in web app). Multi-camera rig mode can now be configured from the web app for the project. Eligible base maps accessible in the mobile app for drivers can now be configured from the web app for the project. Drivers now have the option to cancel when changing projects in the dribvers mobile app. UI updates and refinements across the app. The compass is no longer used for bearing calculations because of the metal carcass of the car is affecting the compass values. Fixed bug where you would be locked out when changing projects without Internet access. Fixed task log sorting. Mapillary for iOS 4.13.1 fixed OSM login bug Get the app on App Store. Mapillary for Android 3.153 min OS supported version Android version is Android 6. Users running Android 4 and 5 can continue using 3.152. Get the app on Google Play Mapillary for Android 3.152 Bugfixes for Marketplace/Explore tab that were crashing the app if location permission was not granted. Bugfix for crash when feed item notification was deep linked into the app. Get the app on Google Play Mapillary for iOS 4.13 fixed bug where "fast mode" was incorrectly detected at 1 m/s, it's now using the correct value of 5 m/s fixed bug where the compass angle would be 90 degrees wrong Get the app on App Store. Mapillary for Android 3.151 Mapillary marketplace is now available in our Android app - browse capture and verification projects right on your phone. Updated structure and navigation: feed items were moved into profile and added explore as main tab. Get the app on Google Play Mapillary for iOS 4.12 Fixed bug where compass override was not working properly. When you are moving fast, for instance when capturing in a car, we don't use the compass and use the GPS locations instead to calculate the bearing. We do this because the metal encasing of the car etc mess with the compass. Fixed bug where compass angle in image review was 90 degrees wrong Fixed bug where manual camera offset override was not properly stored in the sequence Fixed bug where the Mapillary sequences viewer (MJS) could crash due to low memory and thus just show a black screen Get the app on App Store. Verification projects now have a "unsure" button, instead of a "skip" button. This means the voting options are now: yes,no,unsure. Mapillary web app: combined panning and updated compass indicator We enhanced the Mapillary viewer with the Combined Panning feature that lets you pan between overlapping regular images just like you would do with a full panorama, simply by dragging with your mouse. This release also brings an updated compass indicator. Read more on our blog. New features and improvements Improved compass indicator including the possible field of view Automatic scaling of zoom and compass elements Viewer handles zero-sized element correctly Mapillary for iOS 4.9 Now uses the Mapillary open-source SDK for the core capture functionality Much faster image processing (adding the EXIF before uploading) Faster uploading of images (using the AWS SDK) Better positioning of images captured with external cameras (you can now synchronize images and positions manually before you upload) Manually set exposure point is now displayed in the camera UI Added the ability to skip to next/prev image when reviewing; just tap on the right/left side of the image instead of swiping Altitude information is now added to image_detections Fixed bugs related to transferring images from external cameras Fixed bug where the power saving feature could lower the screen brightness even if the setting was disabled Fixed bug where magnetic and true north in EXIF were using the same value Get the app on App Store. Mapillary Command Line Tools 0.5.0 Added command to upload Blackvue DR900S videos directly to Mapillary Added download of images selected by image key Allow GPX files without altitude data More robust support of irregular time formats in EXIF Add argument to skip subfolders to all commands More robust support for filenames including irregular characters on different platforms Improve error information display Fixed bug where orientation was ignored if it was 0 With Verification Projects, map makers and GIS experts can review machine-extracted map data by adding human validation to the workflow. Comprising a project dashboard and a simple game-based tool for verifying object detections, Verification Projects enable quality assurance of the data available in any area, as well as help to improve Mapillary's machine learning algorithms with human feedback. Read more on our blog. With the help of Capture Projects, organizations can manage a team of drivers to capture street-level imagery in an area. Capture Projects consists of a project dashboard on the Mapillary web app and a new mobile app, called Mapillary for Drivers. Read the announcement. Mapillary for Android v3.147 Regex API checks for username and password at signup Fixes the internet connection issues that the users have noticed on Android 9 Map displays as it should on Android 4, 5, and 6. Get the app on Google Play. Mapillary web app: improved icon set for point features on the map Update to our iconography for Point Features , improving 24 icons out of 36 in total. This release brings support for fisheye projection. Mapillary web app: new map styles, more image settings New map styles: it's now possible to use the basemap styles "Mapbox Light" and "Mapillary Streets" (our internal style that is currently in beta). Improved image details with camera make and model as well as image resolution Signup and login forms and validation now better optimized for mobile screens Added a "3D display settings" option where you can turn on and off navigation transitions. Update to map features with 42 object classes added 42 new types of map features are now extracted from street-level imagery and automatically positioned onto the map, ranging from utility poles and streetlights to mailboxes and manholes. Read the announcement. Tag fill for outline detection polygons shown in panoramas: this means that we can render computer vision segmentations with fill and have the same hover functionality as in regular images also for panoramas. Mapillary Command Line Tools 0.4.0 Improved processing of Blackvue videos with embedded GPS data Added features for process_csv command More options for storing local image file path Improved and added features for post_process command Argument --video_import_path can be single video or a directory of videos Duplicate flagging is now done automatically with the default duplicate thresholds.
